pr_title: [avmfritz] Refactoring of discovery service and internal event handling

timeline.message:
Refactoring of discovery service and internal event handling

Signed-off-by: Christoph Weitkamp <github@christophweitkamp.de>

timeline.bodyText: device.isSwitchableOutlet seems redundant when device.getSwitch() could be made to return false if it wasn't a switchable outlet.
timeline.author: cpmeister

timeline.bodyText: It might be better to adjust the logic so you only need to check device instanceof DeviceModel and cast to DeviceModel only once. But it might also make the logic less readable so I'm fine if you don't want to change it.
timeline.author: cpmeister

timeline.bodyText: device.getHkr() should probably be cached to a local variable
timeline.author: cpmeister
cpmeister

timeline.bodyText: ((GroupModel) device).getGroupinfo() should be cached to a local variable
timeline.author: cpmeister

replies.bodyText: Yes, I am aware of all those minor improvements. To be honest, I am not very happy with the current code. My plan is to refactor the binding step by step.
replies.author: cweitkamp

timeline.author: cpmeister

timeline.bodyText: If onDeviceRemove/onDeviceGone cause the thing to go offline, wouldn't adding the device make the thing go online?
timeline.author: cpmeister

replies.bodyText: No, onDeviceAdded() will only be called if no Thing is available.
replies.author: cweitkamp

timeline.bodyText: This logic is also used in AVMFritzBaseThingHandler so it should be refactored into a utility class.
timeline.author: cpmeister

timeline.bodyText: Is there no constant in the core for this channel type?
timeline.author: cpmeister

replies.bodyText: No, there are no constants for the channel type uids.
replies.author: cweitkamp
